Description: Body fragment of large pottery closed vessel, probably an oinochoe (or amphora?); outside horizontal painted band, above zone with painted decoration, two rosettes (part of a zone with animal frieze decoration) and one cross; red-brown paint; interior unglazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 91 no. Nau 33, pl. 8 no. d)
CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 9 no. 1 (bottom), pl. 2 no. 1.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.053)
